result.execSummary:
The defendant Therese T Shaver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

-AODA assessment - to be completed within 60 days.  Proof of compliance is to be filed with the Clerk of Courts office and DA's office within that timeframe.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Warrant was canceled.  Talked to Rhonda at GLSO.
to Modify Warrant

from Clerk to Defendant re: Payment Arrangements
No Appearance by Defendant.  Defendant has made payment arrangements.  Court orders Warrant - stay pending compliance with Payment Plan
Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding
FTP Hearing 04-18-2016 for $623.50

9:56 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with a fine & costs, AODA and DNA surcharge.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$100 fine plus court costs - Corut grants the defendant 60 dasy to pay or payment plan.
-AODA Assessment - Must be filed with the Clerk of Courts and DA's office within 60 days.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Court adjourned at 10:02 a.m.
